alert.note: Alert for Deltana and Tanana Flats; Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued May 30 at 2:07PM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FOR THE SALCHA RIVER FROM 10 PM AKDT THIS EVENING THROUGH THURSDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...The Salcha River. * WHEN...From 10 PM AKDT this evening through Thursday evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive rainfall runoff may flood low lying areas on the Salcha River which could cause water to encroach onto property and around prone cabins. Expect increased debris in the river and possible increased erosion. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Heavy rainfall over the Salcha River Basin have already caused rapid rises along the Salcha River with additional rainfall over the next 36 hours expected to push the Salcha River to possible minor flood stage starting at the Upper River Wednesday with the crest reaching the Richardson Highway Bridge Thursday night.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: Deltana and Tanana Flats; Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country
